title: Palestinians describe Israeli assault on Al-Shifa Hospital: 'If we went outside, we were killed'
summary: Gaza's largest hospital was completely destroyed by an Israeli attack and the fighting around it. Palestinians are still exhuming bodies three weeks later.

title: UK passes bill to deport asylum seekers to Rwanda
summary: Prime Minister Rishi Sunak announced earlier on Monday that the government is prepared to initiate the first deportation flights within 10 to 12 weeks.

title: Antonio Scurati: 'In Italy, the post-fascist group in power has chosen to rewrite history'
summary: The Italian writer confided to Le Monde the speech intended to read on RAI 3 for Italy's liberation commemoration on April 25, in which he denounces Giorgia Meloni's far-right party for distorting history. However, the public broadcaster canceled his speech.

title: Trump accused of 'criminal conspiracy' in opening statements of his NY criminal trial
summary: The historic case poses substantial risks for Trump less than seven months before his election rematch with President Joe Biden.

title: Marine Le Pen, in Mayotte, accuses the government of abandoning the French island
summary: As a French operation began in the French Indian Ocean department of Mayotte on April 16, the far-right Rassemblement National leader visited. Capitalizing on local feelings of anger, concern and disappointment, she aims to show off her defense of the island.

title: TV tower in Ukraine's Kharkiv collapses after Russian strike
summary: Kharkiv's governor said Russia had hit a 'television infrastructure facility,' resulting in a TV service outage. Additionally, Ukrainian officials said Russian strikes in eastern and southern Ukraine wounded several people, and Russia announced having made gains.

title: Italy's public broadcaster RAI censors writer Antonio Scurati
summary: The author, known for his novels about Benito Mussolini, was supposed to read a text denouncing the right-wing government's lack of anti-fascist commitment at Italy's liberation commemoration on April 25, 1945. The public broadcasting group canceled his talk.

title: UNRWA review finds it 'irreplaceable and indispensable' yet with 'neutrality-related issues'
summary: The independent review of the UN agency for Palestinians, led by a former French foreign minister, was launched after Israeli allegations that UNRWA staff participated in Hamas attacks, yet it noted that Israel had yet to provide evidence for these claims.

title: French far right is out to conquer older voters
summary: Particularly active during mid-term elections, elderly electors have been the focus of the far-right Rassemblement National party's strategy. To win them over, they have stepped up efforts to reassure and show their seriousness.

title: The major stimulus plan that could change Italy
summary: With almost €200 billion in loans and grants, Rome has received the lion's share of 'Next Generation EU,' the European aid package set up following the Covid-19 pandemic. This could boost growth, particularly by financing infrastructure, provided it is well spent.

title: Taiwan hit by numerous quakes, strongest reaching 6.3 magnitude
summary: The series of earthquakes comes just weeks after the Hualien region was the epicenter of a magnitude-7.4 quake that hit on April 3.

title: Inter Milan win Serie A title after beating rival AC Milan 2-1
summary: Inter have become the second team to win 20 Italian league titles and will have a second star stitched onto their jersey.

title: EU threatens to suspend 'addictive' TikTok Lite rewards
summary: The EU intitated a second probe into TikTok, more specifically TikTok Lite, which rewards users for watching videos. The EU Commission has warned of 'serious damage for the mental health of users' and threatened to suspend the app's rewards function.

title: Europe struggles to strengthen Ukraine's air defense system
summary: Countries across Europe are reluctant to part with their most advanced defense systems. In Luxembourg on Monday, foreign ministers are due to try to step up their support.

title: Turkish President Erdogan makes rare state visit to Iraq
summary: Erdogan, in his first official visit to the neighboring country since 2011, was set to discuss issues of water supply, oil and gas exports, and regional security with his Iraqi counterparts, amid a highly tense regional context.

title: Europol wants to bypass WhatsApp and Signal encryption
summary: In a joint appeal made public on Sunday, European police forces are calling on governments to allow message encryption on communication platforms to be circumvented.

title: Low-cost flights are increasing France's carbon footprint
summary: According to a study by the NGO Transport & Environment, the sharp increase in low-cost airline activity since 2022 is responsible for the current increase in greenhouse gas emissions in the French airline sector.

title: French 'The Voice' star Kendji Girac hospitalized with bullet wound
summary: The 27-year-old singer was taken to hospital in Bordeaux on Monday after he reportedly hurt himself handling a gun.

title: Zelensky says US aid should help 'stabilize' front so Ukraine can 'overtake the initiative'
summary: Washington's $60.8 billion aid package will be used to reinforce the front line, with a new Russian offensive expected in the coming weeks.

title: North Korea simulates a 'nuclear counterattack' drill
summary: South Korea's military said Monday that missiles flew from the Pyongyang area for about 300 kilometers before splashing down in the waters east of the Korean peninsula.

title: Ukrainian rape survivors experience silence or shame
summary: Since the start of the war on February 24, 2022, many Ukrainian women have been sexually abused by Russian soliders. Even though the subject remains taboo, testimonies are gradually emerging. Florence Aubenas gauges the extent of the trauma.

title: Pierre Hermé, French chocolatier: 'Learning to taste wine has helped me in my pastry-making career'
summary: The sweet artist cultivated a passion for oenology after an apprenticeship. The 2,000 bottles in his cellar help formalize his taste sensations.

title: The ECB vice president says 'the June interest rate cut is a fait accompli'
summary: In an interview with Le Monde, Luis de Guindos said he believes the eurozone is close to winning the battle against inflation.

title: Rekindled love: 'I conquered her at 17, and she won me back at 60'
summary: They met, fell in love and then split before the whirlwind of life brought them back together again. Guillaume, 60, recounts his story with Christine.

title: UK's Sunak overpowers House of Lords to pass bill to send asylum seekers to Rwanda
summary: Early on Tuesday, both houses of the British Parliament approved the 'Safety of Rwanda' bill, denounced by UN experts and associations who point out its contradictions with the European Convention on Human Rights.

title: Canada's wildfire season begins early
summary: More than 110 fires are already active in the province of British Columbia, some of which started last year but never went out.

title: Asia most affected by climate-related disasters in 2023
summary: The World Meteorological Organization recorded 79 climate-related hazard events in the region, which is home to 60% of the world's population.

title: 'Back to Black,' Amy Winehouse was made out of music and love
summary: With this biopic dedicated to the British singer who died at the age of 27, Sam Taylor-Johnson succeeds in embodying the vertigo of the artistic gesture.

title: Highest-level rainstorm warning issued in southern China
summary: The bad weather that has been affecting Guangdong province since Thursday has claimed at least four lives and led to tens of thousands of evacuations, according to the latest figures.

title: UN urges UK to reconsider Rwanda deportation plan
summary: Both houses of the British Parliament approved early on Tuesday the Rwanda deportation bill that could see the removal of those seeking asylum.

title: Southeast Asia hit by extreme heat wave
summary: In Thailand, Myanmar, Cambodia, Vietnam and the Philippines, temperatures are reaching 40° or even 45°C.

title: At least five migrants, including a child, die attempting to cross English Channel
summary: This latest tragedy comes as the British parliament passes a bill to deport illegal migrants to Rwanda in a step to deter these small boat crossings.

title: Russia's use of prisoners to feed war machine is widespread
summary: A law passed at the end of March allows suspects to escape conviction if they choose to go fight on the front lines in Ukraine.
